text:
**Broadcast Rights**: Amazon Prime Video has secured the exclusive broadcast rights to the US-based Twenty20 MLC competition in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 season.

**Availability**: All 25 games will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

**Players**: The second MLC season features several Australian and New Zealand internationals, including Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, and Rachin Ravindra.

**Other Broadcast Partners**: MLC games will also air on US regional sports networks (RSNs) such as YES Network and Monumental Sports Network, and the Indian rights have been acquired by Sony Pictures Network.

**Upcoming Match**: The next matchup will be between the Los Angeles Knight Riders and the Seattle Orcas on 9th July.

**Seattle Orcas' Ambitious Plan**: The Seattle Orcas, the only small market team in the six-team MLC, aim to become "America's Team" by building a brand that resonates beyond Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.

**"Pod Squad" Initiative**: The Orcas have encouraged fans to form the "Pod Squad", a group of passionate fans who can come together to support the team, not just in Seattle but across the country.

**Community Focus**: The franchise is focused on growing cricket from the ground up by putting in effort to get kids interested in the sport and introducing "cricket in a box" programs in schools.

**Stadium Plans**: A home ground for the Orcas is planned at King County's Marymoor Park, which is expected to hold 6,000-8,000 fans and be ready by the 2026 season. It may also host Olympic cricket games in 2028.

**Current Season**: The Orcas are looking to improve on their runner-up finish last year, despite losing their opening game to MI New York. They have a mix of international stars like Heinrich Klaasen, Quinton de Kock, and local talent like Aaron Jones.

**Long-term Goals**: The Orcas' co-owner, Soma Somasegar, envisions a future where cricket becomes mainstream in the US, with the franchise playing a key role in building the sport from the ground up.

* The second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament is currently underway in the United States.
* The first season of MLC was won by MI New York, an offshoot of the Indian Premier League (IPL) team Mumbai Indians.
* In the 2024 season, Faf du Plessis scored the first century against Washington Freedom, followed by Ryan Rickelton's century for Seattle Orcas against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* A total of 4 centuries have been scored in the MLC tournament over the last 2 seasons.
* The first century in MLC was scored by Heinrich Klaasen of Seattle Orcas against MI New York in the 2023 season, with an unbeaten 110 runs off 44 balls.
* Four different batsmen have scored centuries in MLC history: Nicholas Pooran, Heinrich Klaasen, Faf du Plessis, and Ryan Rickelton, with no one scoring multiple centuries.

* The Texas Super Kings will face the Washington Freedom in a Major League Cricket match on Monday, July 8, 2024, at 3:00 p.m. ET.
* Last season, the Super Kings finished second in the standings, while the Freedom finished third, with the Super Kings ultimately losing to MI New York in the title match.
* Currently, the Super Kings are 0-1 and in fifth place, while the Freedom are 1-0 and in third place.
* The match will be played at one of two venues, either Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, or Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.
* The entire Major League Cricket season will take place in July, following the hosting of the T20 World Cup in the United States.
* The match can be watched on Willow TV, which is available through Fubo, and offers over 220 live cricket matches per year.

The San Francisco Unicorns have started their 2024 Major League Cricket season with a six-wicket victory over the Los Angeles Knight Riders, while the Texas Super Kings suffered a defeat to LAKR and then had a no result against the Washington Freedom due to rain.

The Unicorns restricted LAKR to 165-6 in 20 overs and then chased down the target in 15.2 overs, thanks to excellent innings from Finn Allen and Matt Short. The Texas Super Kings, on the other hand, were beaten by 12 runs by LAKR in their opening game, scoring only 150-8 in 20 overs.

The article provides betting analysis for the upcoming match between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Texas Super Kings. The Unicorns are favored to post a total above 200 if they bat first, and Liam Plunkett is tipped to be their top bowler. For the Texas Super Kings, Zia-ul-Haq is expected to be their best bowler, and Marcus Stoinis is predicted to score 30+ runs.

The expert prediction is that the San Francisco Unicorns will outscore the Texas Super Kings in the upcoming match, given the Unicorns' strong top four and the high-scoring nature of the pitch.

**Key Figures:** Dhiraj Malhotra, a prominent figure in the cricketing world with over 20 years of experience, is the CEO of an MLC franchise.

**Tournament Details:** The article does not provide specific dates or formats for the tournament. However, it mentions that Malhotra aims to establish academies, community engagement programs, and ensure year-round relevance for the Washington Freedom team.

**Teams:** The Washington Freedom team is mentioned as one of the teams in the MLC.

**Infrastructure:** Malhotra plans to build a home stadium for the Washington Freedom team in the DC area.

**Challenges:** Establishing cricket in the US faces challenges due to limited infrastructure and underdeveloped cricket ecosystems.

**Goals:** Malhotra's goal is to transform the sport in the US market, focusing on community building, talent development, and year-round relevance for the team. He aspires to have local talent playing for the franchise in the long term.

* Gerald Coetzee, a South African pacer, has been ruled out of the remainder of the MLC 2024 tournament due to a low-grade left side strain injury.
* Coetzee sustained the injury during the tournament opener on July 5, where he took 1 for 28 in four overs against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* Texas Super Kings (TSK) has not yet named a replacement for Coetzee.
* TSK is set to face Washington Freedom in their next match, with veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo included in the playing 11.

Note: The article does not provide an update on the current standings or scoreboard of the MLC 2024 tournament.

**Tournament Details:**

* 2024 US Major League Cricket (MLC) season will take place from July 6 to 29
* 25 matches will be played
* Tournament will feature top international T20 players and leading domestic talent from six US cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

**Participating Teams and Players:**

* San Francisco Unicorns: Pat Cummins, Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Matt Henry
* Seattle Orcas: Michael Bracewell and Lance Morris
* Washington Freedom: Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Rachin Ravindra, and Lockie Ferguson (coached by Ricky Ponting)
* MI New York: Tim David and Trent Boult
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Adam Zampa

**Broadcasting Rights:**

* Prime Video has acquired exclusive broadcasting rights for the 2024 MLC season in Australia and New Zealand
* All 25 matches will be streamed at no additional cost to Prime or Prime Video members in Australia and New Zealand
* Matches can be watched on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, Fire TV stick, Fire tablets, and Apple TV, and can be downloaded for offline viewing

**Other Notes:**

* The tournament follows the success of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, where the USA advanced to the Super Eight stage
* Prime Video is expanding its live sports offering in Australia and New Zealand, and this partnership marks a significant milestone in MLC's journey to grow the season.

* The fifth match of the Major League Cricket 2024 will be played between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings at the Church Street Park in Morrisville on July 8.
* This is the second match for both teams, with Washington Freedom winning their first match against MI New York and Texas Super Kings losing their opening match against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* Washington Freedom has a previous win against Texas Super Kings in the last edition by six runs.
* Steve Smith is the captain of Washington Freedom, while Faf du Plessis leads Texas Super Kings.
* In the last season, Texas Super Kings finished second, while Washington Freedom finished third in the standings.
* The match will be telecast on Sports 18 channel and streamed live on JioCinema app and website in India.
* The probable playing XIs for both teams are listed in the article, with Travis Head, Steven Smith, and Glenn Maxwell featuring in Washington Freedom, and Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, and Marcus Stoinis featuring in Texas Super Kings.

The article is about a prediction competition for the Major League Cricket tournament. Participants are asked to predict which team will win the tournament, the highest run-scorer, and the wicket-taker. The competition closes on July 15th, 2024, and the winner will receive a shirt of their favorite team.

**Match Details:**

* Match 6: Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAS) vs Seattle Orcas (SEA)
* Date: July 9, 2024 (Tuesday)
* Time: 06:00 A.M. IST (Wednesday) / 12:30 AM GMT (Jul 10) / 07:30 PM LOCAL
* Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

**Head-to-Head:**

* Seattle Orcas lost to Los Angeles Knight Riders in MLC 2023 during the group stage.

**Weather and Pitch Report:**

* Clear weather with a temperature of 31Â°C and humidity level of 40-45%.
* The pitch is good for batting, with the ball moving more in the evening and spinners being more effective. Shorter side boundaries will also help batters.

**Predicted XIs:**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Jason Roy, Sunil Narine (c), Unmukt Chand (wk), Shakib Al Hasan, Nitish Kumar, David Miller, Andre Russell, Adam Zampa, Corne Dry, Spencer Johnson, Ali Khan
* Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock (wk), Nauman Anwar, Aaron Jones, Shubham Ranjane, Heinrich Klaasen (c), Imad Wasim, Michael Bracewell, Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Nandre Burger, Zaman Khan

**Dream11 Prediction:**

* The article predicts that Los Angeles Knight Riders will win due to their better combination of star all-rounders and experience playing in Dallas.

**Match Details**: The 6th match of the Major League Cricket 2024 will be played between Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas on July 10th at 6:00 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Teams' Recent Form**: Los Angeles Knight Riders have a mixed record with a win and a loss, while Seattle Orcas lost their opening match to MI New York.

**Pitch Report**: The pitch is expected to be fast-paced, with seamers likely to pick up most wickets and spinners getting a few. A score of over 170 is considered a match-winning total.

**Probable Winners**: Seattle Orcas are expected to win this match.

**Probable Playing XIs**: The article provides the expected playing elevens for both teams, including players like Jason Roy, Sunil Narine, Quinton de Kock, and Andre Russell.

**Fantasy Cricket Tips**: The article provides top picks for batters, all-rounders, bowlers, and wicketkeepers, as well as suggested fantasy teams and an X-factor player (Shakib Al Hasan).

**Pre-Match Analysis**: Los Angeles Knight Riders are looking to bounce back from their loss to San Francisco Unicorns, while Seattle Orcas aim to secure their first win of the tournament.

* Unmukt Chand, a player for the Los Angeles Knight Riders, has spoken about overcoming a personal setback, which he described as a "big shock" that took time to come to terms with.
* Despite this, he contributed to his team's win against the Texas Super Kings with a 45-ball 68 in their first match of the season.
* Chand revealed that he trained in Maharashtra during the T20 World Cup 2024, where the USA created history by beating Pakistan and progressing to the Super 8 stage.
* Chand will be seen in action again when the LA Knight Riders take on the Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on June 9.

* Unmukt Chand, a former India U-19 World Cup winning captain, played in the inaugural edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) and became eligible to play for the USA.
* Chand started off the second season of MLC with a swashbuckling half-century, scoring 68 off 45 balls, hitting six 4s and three 6s.
* He currently plays for the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) franchise, which is owned by the Knight Riders group.

* A large chunk of South African players named in the Test squad are currently playing in the Major League Cricket (MLC) T20 tournament in the US.
* These players will need to adjust to the Test format quickly, as they will not have much preparation time before the two Tests against the West Indies next month.
* The MLC contracted players will have to rely on training camps and a sole warm-up match in Trinidad to get ready for the longer format.
* Coach Shukri Conrad is optimistic about the team's preparation, citing the luxury of a warm-up game and 10 days in Trinidad before the first Test.

In the Major League Cricket tournament, the Seattle Orcas defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders by 9 wickets. LA Knight Riders scored 168-5, thanks to David Miller's 44* off 22 balls. However, Seattle Orcas chased down the target with a ball to spare, led by Ryan Rickelton's exceptional 103* off 66 balls on his MLC debut, and Quinton de Kock's 51* off 46 balls.

* The article is reporting on a match in the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.
* Faf du Plessis is the captain of the Texas Super Kings team in the tournament.
* In the match, du Plessis scored a century in 46 balls, helping his team reach a total of 203.
* However, he was dismissed by Saurabh Netravalkar of Washington Freedom in the penultimate over of the innings.
* Unfortunately, the match was called off due to rain after just four overs of the second innings, with Washington Freedom scoring 62 runs.
* Saurabh Netravalkar has been in good form, having been named 'Player of the Match' in the first game of the season where he took three wickets for 24 runs in four overs.

**Match Details**

* Match 6 of MLC 2024
* Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAS) vs Seattle Orcas (SEA)
* Date: July 10th
* Time: 6:00 AM IST
* Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, United States

**Head-to-Head Stats**

* The teams have played only one match against each other in the previous edition, with LAS winning the game.

**Pitch Report**

* The pitch at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas offers a balanced contest between bat and ball.
* Average first-innings score: 163
* Average second-innings score: 158
* Highest total recorded: 166/4 by SFU vs LAS
* Lowest total recorded: 150/8 by TEX vs LAS

**Fantasy Cricket Tips and Predictions**

* Top-order batters and big-hitters will be good picks for fantasy contests.
* Spin bowlers from either side will also get good points.
* The Los Angeles Knight Riders are the favourites to win the game.
* Top player picks: Spencer Johnson (LAS), Shakib Al Hasan (LAS), Cameron Gannon (SEA), Quinton de Kock (SEA)
* Differential picks: Unmukt Chand (LAS), Heinrich Klaasen (SEA)

**Match Preview**

The Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) will face the Seattle Orcas in the sixth game of Major League Cricket 2024 on July 10 at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Dallas. LAKR, led by Sunil Narine, currently sit in fourth place with one win and one loss, while the Seattle Orcas are in last place with one loss.

**Teams and Players**

The probable playing XIs for the match are:

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: AT Carey, DA Miller (C), UBT Chand (VC), Saif Badar, AD Russell, JJ Roy, Nitish Kumar, SP Narine, Shakib Al Hasan, J Little, SH Johnson
* Seattle Orcas: H Klaasen (C), S Jayasuriya, Q de Kock (VC), RD Rickelton, IM Wasim, Michael Bracewell, WD Parnell, N Burger, Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, OC McCoy

**Pitch Report**

The pitch at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium is known for its batting-friendly conditions, with short boundaries and true bounce, making it a high-scoring venue. Pacers will need to be accurate with their lines and lengths to be effective.

**Injury and Availability News**

There are no injury updates from either side.

**Dream11 Prediction and Fantasy Cricket Tips**

The article provides fantasy cricket tips and player picks, including Shakib Al Hasan and Andre Russell from LAKR, and advises against selecting Imad Wasim and Ali Sheikh from the Seattle Orcas.

**Match Details**

* Match 6 of the Major League Cricket 2024 will be played between Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas on July 10, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Team Background**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders lost their previous match to San Francisco Unicorns, despite posting a competitive score of 165/6.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs in their inaugural match against MI New York and lost by 6 wickets.

**Team News**

* Both teams have no injury concerns and are expected to field their full-strength squads.

**Form Guide**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders have an inconsistent record in their last five matches, with two wins and three losses.
* Seattle Orcas have also struggled with consistency, winning two and losing three of their last five matches.

**Pitch and Weather**

* The Grand Prairie Stadium pitch is known to favor batsmen, making it ideal for high-scoring encounters.
* The weather forecast is mild and partly cloudy, with a slight chance of rain.

**Predicted XI**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Jason Roy, Sunil Narine, Unmukt Chand, Shakib Al Hasan, Nitish Kumar, David Miller, Andre Russell, Derone Davis, Corne Dry, Spencer Johnson, Ali Khan.
* Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock, Aaron Jones, Nauman Anwar, Heinrich Klaasen, Michael Bracewell, Shubham Ranjane, Imad Wasim, Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Nandre Burger, Zaman Khan.

**Head-to-Head**

* This is the first meeting between the two teams.

**Match Prediction**

* If Los Angeles Knight Riders bat first, they are predicted to score 180-190 and win the match by 20-30 runs.
* If Seattle Orcas bat first, they are predicted to score 155-165 and lose the match by 7 wickets.
* Overall, Los Angeles Knight Riders are favored to win the match.

* Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) won their first match in MLC 2024 by defeating Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 12 runs at the Grand Prairie Stadium.
* LAKR set a competitive target of 163 runs, with Unmukt Chand scoring 68 and Nitish Kumar adding 26.
* Andre Russell was bizarrely dismissed for 10 runs, hitting his own stumps with the bat while trying to play a shot.
* In the second innings, LAKR bowler Ali Khan shone, taking 4/33 to restrict TSK's scoring rate.
* TSK opener Devon Conway scored a half-century (53), but the team fell short of the target, managing only 150/8 in 20 overs.

**Match Details**

* Match 7: San Francisco Unicorns (SF) vs Texas Super Kings (TEX)

* Venue: Church Street Park, North Carolina

* Top Bowlers: Zia-ul-Haq (TEX) - 2 wickets, Haris Rauf (SF) - 2 wickets, Brody Couch (SF) - 2 wickets

**Match Prediction**

* San Francisco Unicorns are predicted to win Match 7.
* If SF bats first, they are expected to score 170-190 runs and win by 50-70 runs.
* If TEX bats first, they are expected to score 160-180 runs and SF will win by 6 wickets.

* Predicted Playing 11 for both teams are provided.

**Match Result:** The match between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings was called off due to heavy rain, with both teams sharing the points.

**First Innings:** Texas Super Kings scored 203/5 in 20 overs, with Faf du Plessis top-scoring with 100 off 58 balls. Saurabh Netravalkar was the pick of the Washington Freedom bowlers, taking 2/33 in four overs.

**Second Innings:** Washington Freedom were 62/0 in four overs, with Steve Smith scoring 26 off 13 balls and Travis Head scoring 32 off 12 balls, when the match was called off due to rain.

**Tournament Standings:** Washington Freedom moved to the top of the MLC 2024 points table with three points from two matches.

**Next Match:** Washington Freedom will play their next match against the Seattle Orcas on Thursday at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Defending Champions: MI New York**
MI New York won the championship trophy in Texas last year and is expected to be the team to beat this year, with a roster very similar to the one that won it all last year.

**Teams to Watch:**

* Seattle Orcas: Consistent team last year, with a strong core of players remaining intact, and new additions to replace Shimron Hetmyer and Andrew Tye.
* Texas Super Kings: After a disappointing playoff exit, TSK has made significant changes, bringing in big names like Aiden Markram, Marcus Stoinis, and Naveen ul-Haq to replace departed players.
* Washington Freedom: Despite losing key players, the addition of Steve Smith, Rachin Ravindra, and Lockie Ferguson strengthens the team's chances of returning to the playoffs.
* San Francisco Unicorns: With new captain Pat Cummins and additions like Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, and Sherfane Rutherford, the Unicorns could be a playoff contender.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: After a disappointing season last year, LAKR hopes to turn things around with the addition of David Miller, Shakib Al Hasan, and Josh Little.

**Tournament Format:**
Each team will play seven matches, with games split between Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. Matches will be broadcast on the Willow cable channel and app, as well as various regional sports networks.
